intro: Ipomopsis polyantha, commonly known as the blue flax or blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Ipomopsis polyantha is valued for its ornamental beauty and its role in supporting pollinators like butterflies and bees.
